pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:0.5.eng: The training rule on throwing out

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhaddā kāpilānī sākete vassaṃ upagatā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.2.eng: At that time Bhaddā Kāpilānī had entered the rainy-season residence at Sāketa.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.3.pli: Sā kenacideva karaṇīyena ubbāḷhā thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.3.eng: But because she was disturbed by a certain matter, she sent a message to the nun Thullanandā:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.4.pli: “sace me ayyā thullanandā upassayaṃ dadeyya āgaccheyyāmahaṃ sāvatthin”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.4.eng: “If you would give me a dwelling place, I would come to Sāvatthī.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.7.pli: Atha kho bhaddā kāpilānī sāketā sāvatthiṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.7.eng: Bhaddā Kāpilānī then traveled from Sāketa to Sāvatthī,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.8.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī bhaddāya kāpilāniyā upassayaṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.8.eng: and Thullanandā gave her a dwelling place.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī bahussutā hoti bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.9.eng: At that time Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.10.pli: Bhaddāpi kāpilānī bahussutā hoti bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ uḷārasambhāvitā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.10.eng: Bhaddā Kāpilānī, too, was a learned reciter who was confident and skilled at giving teachings, and she was respected for her excellence.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.12.pli: “ayyā bhaddā kāpilānī bahussutā bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ uḷārasambhāvitā”ti bhaddaṃ kāpilāniṃ paṭhamaṃ payirupāsitvā pacchā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ payirupāsanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.12.eng: Because of this, people visited Bhaddā Kāpilānī first and then Thullanandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.14.pli: “imā kira appicchā santuṭṭhā pavivittā asaṃsaṭṭhā yā imā saññattibahulā viññattibahulā viharantī”ti kupitā anattamanā bhaddaṃ kāpilāniṃ upassayā nikkaḍḍhi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.14.eng: “These ones, who are supposedly contented and have few desires, who are supposedly secluded and not socializing, are always persuading and convincing people.” And in anger she threw Bhaddā Kāpilānī out of that dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.14.comm: Sp 2.941: Saññattibahulā; divasaṁ mahājanaṁ saññāpayamānāti attho. … Viññattīti hetūdāharaṇādīhi vividhehi nayehi ñāpanā veditabbā, na yācanā. “Saññattibahulā; the meaning is they are trying to persuade crowds of people during the day. … Viññatti: not to be understood as asking for things, but as making known by various methods consisting of reasons, examples, etc.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.15.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.15.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.16.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā ayyāya bhaddāya kāpilāniyā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.16.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give a dwelling place to Venerable Bhaddā Kāpilānī and then throw her out in anger?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.17.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhaddāya kāpilāniyā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.17.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.20.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhaddāya kāpilāniyā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.20.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.22.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.22.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.23.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍheyya vā nikkaḍḍhāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.23.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives a dwelling place to a nun, and then, in anger, throws her out or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.8.eng: one that has a door is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.14.pli: gabbhe gahetvā pamukhaṃ nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.14.eng: if she takes hold of her in a room and throws her out to the entryway, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.15.pli: Pamukhe gahetvā bahi nikkaḍḍhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.15.eng: If she takes hold of her in the entryway and throws her outside, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.16.pli: Ekena payogena bahukepi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.16.eng: Even if she makes her go through many doors with a single effort, she commits one offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.18.eng: if she asks another, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.19.pli: Sakiṃ āṇattā bahukepi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.19.eng: If she only asks once, then even if the other makes her go through many doors, she commits one offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematikā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.4.pli: Tassā parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.4.eng: If she throws out one of her requisites, or she has it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.4.comm: “Requisites” renders parikkhāra. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.5.pli: Akavāṭabaddhā nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.5.eng: If she throws her out or has her thrown out from a dwelling place without a door, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.6.pli: Tassā parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.6.eng: If she throws out one of her requisites from a dwelling place without a door, or she has it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.7.pli: Anupasampannaṃ kavāṭabaddhā vā akavāṭabaddhā vā nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.7.eng: If she throws out one who is not fully ordained, or she has her thrown out, from a dwelling place with or without a door, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.7.comm: Anupasampannaṁ could in theory be either male or female, but since the rest of this permutation series uses the feminine gender, I take it that the feminine is to be understood here as well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.8.pli: Tassā parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.8.eng: If she throws out one of her requisites from that place, or she has it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.9.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.10.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.11.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.2.eng: if she throws out, or has thrown out, one who is shameless;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.3.pli: tassā parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.3.eng: if she throws out, or has thrown out, a requisite belonging to that person;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.4.eng: if she throws out, or has thrown out, one who is insane;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.5.pli: tassā parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.5.eng: if she throws out, or has thrown out, a requisite belonging to that person;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.6.pli: bhaṇḍanakārikaṃ kalahakārikaṃ vivādakārikaṃ bhassakārikaṃ saṅghe adhikaraṇakārikaṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.6.eng: if she throws out, or has thrown out, one who is quarrelsome and argumentative, and who creates legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.7.pli: tassā parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.7.eng: if she throws out, or has thrown out, a requisite belonging to that person;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.8.pli: antevāsiniṃ vā saddhivihāriniṃ vā na sammā vattantiṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.8.eng: if she throws out, or has thrown out, a pupil or student who is not conducting herself properly;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.9.pli: tassā parikkhāraṃ nikkaḍḍhati vā nikkaḍḍhāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.9.eng: if she throws out, or has thrown out, a requisite belonging to that person;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.11.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.12.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī saṃsaṭṭhā viharati gahapatināpi gahapatiputtenapi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.2.eng: the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was socializing with householders and their offspring.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.3.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.3.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā caṇḍakāḷī saṃsaṭṭhā viharissati gahapatināpi gahapatiputtenapī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.4.eng: “How can Venerable Caṇḍakāḷī socialize with householders and their offspring?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī saṃsaṭṭhā viharati gahapatināpi gahapatiputtenapī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī does this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī saṃsaṭṭhā viharissati gahapatināpi gahapatiputtenapi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.8.eng: “How can the nun Caṇḍakāḷī do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.11.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī saṃsaṭṭhā vihareyya gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi evamassa vacanīyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a nun is socializing with a householder or a householder’s offspring, the nuns should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.12.pli: ‘māyye, saṃsaṭṭhā vihari gahapatināpi gahapatiputtenapi. Viviccāyye; vivekaññeva bhaginiyā saṅgho vaṇṇetī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.12.eng: “Venerable, don’t socialize with householders or householders’ offspring. Be secluded, Venerable. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.12.comm: The Pali has the singular bhaginiyā, “for a sister”, but I render it in the plural to fit better with English idiom.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.13.pli: Evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.13.eng: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.14.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsīyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ; no ce paṭinissajjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:1.14.eng: If she then stops, all is well. If she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.6.eng: she socializes with improper bodily and verbal actions.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.10.eng: whoever is an offspring or a sibling.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.10.comm: “Offspring” renders putta/ā, whereas “sibling” renders bhātaro. In Pali the male gender takes precedent if a group contains people of both sexes. For instance, the plural puttā, “sons”, may mean “children” or “offsping”, depending on the context. In the same way, the plural bhātāro, “brothers”, can mean “siblings”. This way of understanding male-gender nouns is confirmed in the introduction to the Pali lexical work the Abhidhānappadīpikāṭīkā: Ettha hi mātā ca pitā ca pitaro, putto ca dhītā ca puttā, sassu ca sasuro ca sasurā, bhātā ca bhaginī ca bhātaroti bhinnaliṅgānampi ekaseso dassitoti, “‘Mother and father are fathers; son and daughter are sons; mother-in-law and father-in-law are fathers-in-law; brother and sister are brothers;’ in this case the split gender is shown with only one gender remaining.” The Abhidhānappadīpikāṭīkā is available online at tipitaka.org.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.14.pli: aññāhi bhikkhunīhi. Yā passanti yā suṇanti tāhi vattabbā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.14.eng: other nuns who see it or hear about it. They should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.15.eng: “Venerable, don’t socialize with householders or householders’ offspring.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.17.eng: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.18.eng: And they should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.20.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.21.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.22.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.23.eng: That nun, even if she has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.24.eng: “Venerable, don’t socialize with householders or householders’ offspring.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.26.eng: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.27.eng: They should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.29.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.30.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.32.eng: “And, monks, she should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.33.eng: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.34.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.35.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī saṃsaṭṭhā viharati gahapatināpi gahapatiputtenapi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.35.eng: The nun so-and-so is socializing with householders and their offspring.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.36.eng: And she keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.37.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāseyya tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.37.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.39.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.40.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī saṃsaṭṭhā viharati gahapatināpi gahapatiputtenapi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.40.eng: The nun so-and-so is socializing with householders and their offspring.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.41.eng: And she keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.42.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.42.eng: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.43.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.43.eng: Any nun who approves of pressing nun so-and-so to make her stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.44.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.45.eng: For the second time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.46.eng: For the third time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.47.pli: Samanubhaṭṭhā saṅghena itthannāmā bhikkhunī tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.47.eng: The Sangha has pressed nun so-and-so to stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.48.pli: khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.48.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.49.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.49.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.50.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.1.51.eng: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematikā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.3.2.eng: if she has not been pressed;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc36:2.3.6.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:0.5.eng: The training rule on within their own country

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ caranti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns went wandering without a group of travelers where it was considered risky and dangerous within their own country.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.3.comm: “Raped” renders dūsenti. For a discussion of this word, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.4.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.4.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ carissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.5.eng: “How can nuns go wandering without a group of travelers where it’s considered risky and dangerous within their own country?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ carantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ carissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.11.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.12.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ careyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:1.12.1.eng: ‘If a nun goes wandering without a group of travelers where it is considered risky and dangerous within her own country, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.6.eng: in the country where she is living.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.8.pli: tasmiṃ magge corānaṃ niviṭṭhokāso dissati, bhuttokāso dissati, ṭhitokāso dissati, nisinnokāso dissati, nipannokāso dissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.8.eng: a place has been seen along that road where criminals are camping, eating, standing, sitting, or lying down.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.10.pli: tasmiṃ magge corehi manussā hatā dissanti, viluttā dissanti, ākoṭitā dissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.10.eng: criminals have been seen along that road, injuring, robbing, or beating people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.12.eng: in the absence of a group of travelers.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.14.pli: kukkuṭasampāte gāme gāmantare gāmantare āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.14.eng: when the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.14.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “inhabited area” for gāma, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.15.pli: Agāmake araññe addhayojane addhayojane āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.15.eng: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.1.15.comm: “Six kilometers” renders addhayojana, “half a yojana”. For further discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.2.2.eng: if she travels with a group;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.2.3.eng: if she travels where it is safe and free from danger;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.2.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc37:2.2.7.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:0.5.eng: The training rule on outside their own country

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ caranti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns went wandering without a group of travelers where it was considered risky and dangerous outside their own country.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.4.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.4.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ carissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.5.eng: “How can nuns go wandering without a group of travelers where it’s considered risky and dangerous outside their own country?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ carantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ carissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.11.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.12.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikā cārikaṃ careyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:1.12.1.eng: ‘If a nun goes wandering without a group of travelers where it is considered risky and dangerous outside her own country, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.6.pli: yassa vijite viharati, taṃ ṭhapetvā aññassa raṭṭhe.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.6.eng: in any country apart from the one where she is living.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.8.pli: tasmiṃ magge corānaṃ niviṭṭhokāso dissati, bhuttokāso dissati, ṭhitokāso dissati, nisinnokāso dissati, nipannokāso dissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.8.eng: a place has been seen along that road where criminals are camping, eating, standing, sitting, or lying down.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.10.pli: tasmiṃ magge corehi manussā hatā dissanti, viluttā dissanti, ākoṭitā dissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.10.eng: criminals have been seen along that road, injuring, robbing, or beating people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.12.eng: in the absence of a group of travelers.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.14.pli: kukkuṭasampāte gāme gāmantare gāmantare, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.14.eng: when the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.15.pli: Agāmake araññe addhayojane addhayojane āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.15.eng: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.15.comm: “Six kilometers” renders addhayojana, “half a yojana”. For further discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.17.eng: if she travels with a group;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.18.eng: if she travels where it is safe and free from danger;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.21.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc38:2.22.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.
